repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Minas Gerais Basic Education
            Quality Improvement Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is satisfactory,
            sustainability likely, and the institutional development
            impact substantial. Several lessons were drawn from the
            project as follows. The project implementation arrangement
            was uniquely carried through the Education Secretariat in
            Minas Gerais, which proved beneficial in promoting the
            development of institutional memory, allowing a small
            project unit to perform efficiently the role of project
            coordinator unit (PCU), rather than choosing a large
            separate PCU structure. However, the absence of a monitoring
            and evaluation criteria was not fully implemented, making it
            difficult to link precise project activities to the observed
            improvements in the state's quality of education, thus
            missing an opportunity for stronger support from education
            authorities, and civil society, based on pertinent project
            data, and analysis. To this end, it is suggested to build a
            strong technical capacity in the field - through training
            and dissemination mechanisms - to guarantee the development
            of monitoring and evaluation systems. Other lessons address
            issues concerning the need a) to assess the implementing
            agencies' capacity for handling the scope of projects;
            b) to carefully consider the political environment in
            project planning; c) to integrate project financial
            management into the accounting system of the implementing
            agency; and, d) to further develop the state level student
            learning assessment by having test results amply
            disseminated to the civil society, promoting public support
            for quality education.

TF034238-BRAZIL - TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
            IN PROCUREMENT TRAINING AND REVIEW,TF036341-BRAZIL - MINAS GERAIS PROQUILIDADE,TF034004-BRAZIL - PRIMARY EDUCATION,TF032793-BRAZIL - EDUCATION PORTFOLIO

repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - State of Minas Gerais : Basic
            Education Quality Improvement (ProQualidade) Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall goal of the Minas Gerais
            Basic Education Quality Improvement Project is to improve
            educational attainment in the State of Minas Gerais, as
            defined by significant increases in student learning and
            graduation from elementary school. The project will support
            improvements in: a) system - wide management through student
            assessment, educational monitoring, and operational studies
            to foster information-based decision making; b) school
            administration through systematic school planning (including
            school development grants), school leadership development,
            and provision of office technology systems; c) teaching
            competence through increased access of public school
            teachers to training in classroom management, enhancement of
            curriculum development, and evaluation of classroom
            interventions; d) availability of learning materials through
            regular provision of books and other learning aids to all
            students in public classrooms; and e) facility management in
            support of classroom construction and rational school space
            utilization necessary to ensure that all pupils attending
            state schools have access to the locally-standard four and a
            half hours of schooling per day. To achieve these
            objectives, the project will finance educational materials,
            school equipment and furniture, vehicles, civil works,
            technical assistance (including training), and operational
            expenses. The project will also finance project management
            costs of about US $4.4 million equivalent.
